alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton; Meigs; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:50PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Rhea, southeastern Bledsoe, central Meigs and north central Hamilton Counties through 430 PM EDT/330 PM CDT/... At 349 PM EDT/249 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Dayton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Decatur, Spring City, Graysville, Peakland, Piney Falls State Park, Ten Mile, Evensville, Sale Creek and Old Washington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
